caption:
The photograph shows a road scene prominently featuring a weathered road sign for the Nashua River. The sign is rectangular with a white background and bold, black text saying "NASHUA RIVER." It also includes the logo of what appears to be a highway department in the upper left corner, marked with the letters "NH" inside a shield shape with a peak.

In the foreground, on the left side of the image, is a large rectangular roadside warning sign or barrier painted in yellow and black diagonal stripes.

Beyond the sign, along the road, a row of people can be seen walking along the sidewalk parallel to a guardrail, near the edge of a bridge. The individuals are dressed casually, some wearing jeans and carrying bags, suggesting they might be hiking or simply walking along the route. They face away from the camera, heading towards a destination not visible in the shot.

The background includes trees and blue skies with some clouds, indicating it might be a nice day. The overall scene could be set in a suburban or rural area given the nature around and the simplicity of the road setup.
title: Naturalists cross runnells bridge on way to woods along the nissitisset river (a branch of the Nashua), where rare ferns lady slippers and other wild flowers can be found
